div.p: To honor the Class of 2020, Bryan and many other schools in NW Ohio will Shine the Light on Monday night (April 20). Show your support from your homes as well by turning on your porch lights.

em.strong: *Our stadiums will be closed to the community and students during this recognition.

img.alt: Shine Your Light for our Seniors

span.div: Join us for a live broadcast of our April Board Meeting via YouTube (https://youtu.be/TwuM_NyACAQ) or BMU Channel 4 (www.cityofbryan.net/live) on Monday, April 20, at 7pm.

p.span: Welcome to Bryan Middle/High School, serving grades 6-12.

We are thrilled at the opportunity to work with the students, parents, community, and staff of Bryan Middle/High School on a daily basis. It is our goal to create dynamic, multi-faceted learning environments that prepare students for success in order to be
of critical thinking, communication, collaboration, creativity, and community.

Our students have opportunities to excel in Academics, in the Arts, and in Athletics through the many course offerings, extra-curriculars, and teams available to participate in. We take pride in meeting the needs of all of our students.

We look forward to the opportunities of serving your students and preparing them for success. If we can be of assistance to you, or if you have questions about Bryan Middle/High School, please feel free to contact us at 419-636-4536.

span.span: Dear Parents, Guardians and the Bryan Elementary School Community:

Welcome to the new school year! Our commitment at Bryan Elementary is to provide a safe and intellectually challenging environment that will empower students to become innovative thinkers, creative problem solvers and inspired learners prepared to thrive in the twenty-first century.

As the people you have entrusted with the education of your children, we have developed a strong educational program that addresses the need of the 21st century learner. We promote an educational environment that engages the students in meaningful work so that they develop the critical skills necessary to become independent, responsible, and productive citizens. The teachers at Bryan Elementary have many great activities and learning experiences planned for the students this year. We are excited to utilize our Makerspaces in our building. Students will be working collaboratively to solve mini design and building challenges. Many of the challenges that the students have been working on include activities from STEM (Science Technology, Engineering and Math). All of them incorporate hands-on learning using a variety of materials.
